text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Hikaru is an arcade system created by Sega in 1999. It is not based on console hardware, it is a completely dedicated system, originally thought for the game 'Brave Fire Fighters'. It is made up of several interconnected PCBs including a network card and the motherboard supports two Hitachi SH-4 clocked at 200 MHz, twice as much as the Naomi 2. It is capable of displaying 640x480 in 16 million colors , 2 million polygon seconds and was the first arcade system to feature Phong shading. Without forgetting the effects of water, flame and smoke.
